value.title: A Practical Guide To Become a Senior Frontend Developer

content.subtitle: Quarantine Might Be Your Golden Chance

paragraphs.text: A Practical Guide To Become a Senior Frontend Developer

paragraphs.name: 06a5
paragraphs.text: Quarantine Might Be Your Golden Chance

paragraphs.name: 62a6
paragraphs.text: There are several different definitions for the title ├ö├ç├┐Senior├ö├ç├û and it changes from one company to another. Yet, it├ö├ç├ûs agreed upon that there are are a lot of both hard and soft skills required.

paragraphs.name: 45ce
paragraphs.text: Chris Coyier wrote an article about character traits and behaviors that a senior frontend developer should have that gives a nice overall picture.

paragraphs.name: 4f91
paragraphs.text: In this article, we will cover 12 things you can do to make the best out of these times so that when they are over, you can become a senior frontend developer.
Photo by Ruffa Jane Reyes on Unsplash
1. Master The Fundamentals

paragraphs.name: 78e6
paragraphs.text: Senior frontend developers should be very comfortable articulating HTML, JS, and CSS. Additionally, they should have basic concepts about how the internet works including browsers, networks, and servers.

paragraphs.name: d7e0
paragraphs.text: This means that concepts like prototypes, event bubbling, call stack, promises, ES6 are no foreign to you. The same applies to CSS, animations, grid systems, naming conventions, and specificity.

paragraphs.name: 4a7c
paragraphs.text: There are numerous concepts to learn, below you can find some resources that you can skim and look for things you don├ö├ç├ût know about, yet. CSS Reference, Html Reference, Javascript Fundamentals, Frontend Handbook.
2. Get Started By Reading The Documentation

paragraphs.name: 3d49
paragraphs.text: Most developers are curious and want to jump straight to writing code and experimenting with it. That├ö├ç├ûs all good and fun but it├ö├ç├ûs not the most efficient way to go about mastering a framework or tools.

paragraphs.name: a974
paragraphs.text: Reading the documentation is going to help you save time smashing your keyboard trying to figure out how a feature works. It will also spare you from re-implementing existing features that you didn├ö├ç├ût know about.

paragraphs.name: 041e
paragraphs.text: Make sure you read the whole documentation as it is your guide to understanding the ins and outs of the framework.

paragraphs.name: 108d
paragraphs.text: Most of your questions are answered in the docs. If they are not, then you get to contribute to the framework and help others, win-win.

paragraphs.name: 2d11
paragraphs.text: 3. Understand The Build Process
Most frameworks provide you with out of the box build process through a CLI such as angular-cli or create-react-app.

paragraphs.name: 8b07
paragraphs.text: You should know what is happening behind the scenes in order to modify and tweak your build process as your application develops.

paragraphs.name: 78ad
paragraphs.text: Start with understanding the essential concepts such as transpiring, bundling, minifying and packaging. Afterward, you can move into the ├ö├ç├┐nice-to-have├ö├ç├û like linters, hot-reloaders, and git hooks.

paragraphs.name: dac9
paragraphs.text: Once you feel confident in your understanding, bring the pieces together by choosing one of the popular bundlers (webpack/parcel) and start building your first application from scratch.

paragraphs.name: a57f
paragraphs.text: 4. Read The Style Guide

paragraphs.name: dcf1
paragraphs.text: Antipatterns and pitfalls are more common than you think, you can learn from other people├ö├ç├ûs mistakes and avoid wasting yourself and the company lots of valuable time.

paragraphs.name: 6a8b
paragraphs.text: The style guide contains lots of helpful best practices that help you understand the framework even further and have a consistent coding style along with your teammates.

paragraphs.name: 56ad
paragraphs.text: You can also enforce these using linters such as vue-eslint-plugin.

paragraphs.name: 3e6d
paragraphs.text:
Style Guide - Vue.js
This is the official style guide for Vue-specific code. If you use Vue in a project, it's a great reference to avoid├ö├ç┬¬vuejs.org

paragraphs.name: f850
paragraphs.text: 5. Get Hold of The Devtools
Debugging is one of the most valuable tools you have in your toolbox. Developers often read more code than they write and therefore it├ö├ç├ûs very important to be able to debug code quickly.

paragraphs.name: bfa3
paragraphs.text: Using the dev-tools browser extensions, you can view and change the components state and props, track custom events, observe route changes, locate your component in the DOM, and do much more.

paragraphs.name: 5e5c
paragraphs.text: Mastering the dev tools will massively increase your productivity over common debugging methods like console.log or debugger.

paragraphs.name: 9bf7
paragraphs.text:
Debug React applications with the new React DevTools - LogRocket Blog
Debugging is one of the most useful skills a developer can possess. It allows you to properly navigate and spot errors├ö├ç┬¬blog.logrocket.com

paragraphs.name: 953a
paragraphs.text: 6. Grasp Reactivity

paragraphs.name: c682
paragraphs.text: React and Vue both heavily rely on reactivity systems. Grasping these mental models allow you to understand how the framework is built so you can optimize your usage.

paragraphs.name: 9dbf
paragraphs.text: In your journey, you will realize how frameworks listen to state changes and update your DOM automatically. You will also learn about virtual dom and untangle the confusion with shadow dom.

paragraphs.name: dac6
paragraphs.text: Moreover, you will get a deep introduction to declarative programming and how it compares imperative programming which will yield in a great shift in how your write code.

paragraphs.name: b018
paragraphs.text: There is an amazing course on Frontend Masters by Evan You where he explains the reactivity system of Vuejs from the ground up.

paragraphs.name: 5ce5
paragraphs.text: 7. Find Out Different Component Patterns

paragraphs.name: 589c
paragraphs.text: Components are the fundamental units of modern frontend systems. The ability to design and architect several components can have a huge impact on the long term on your project├ö├ç├ûs maintainability.

paragraphs.name: 5f69
paragraphs.text: Equipping yourself with different methodologies and patterns will allow you to scale up your application and introduce new features at ease.

paragraphs.name: 702e
paragraphs.text: Check out these two articles Advance Vuejs Component Patterns and Advanced React Component Patterns for an in-depth explanation.

paragraphs.name: e3b4
paragraphs.text: 8. Write Composable Code

paragraphs.name: c91d
paragraphs.text: Code composition is one of the attributes of well-designed software systems.

paragraphs.name: 7ffd
paragraphs.text: Leveraging code composition you will be able to reuse existing code, and come up with bigger composable pieces and hence avoid having too many components.
Almost all communities have established a set of patterns to compose your code such as react-hooks or in the vue world, the vue-composition API, and mixins.

paragraphs.name: 6b0c
paragraphs.text: Look in your codebase and search for potential use-cases to experiment with these patterns and see if it improves your codebase.

paragraphs.name: 7cf4
paragraphs.text: 9. Optimize Components Communication

paragraphs.name: a1b9
paragraphs.text: In modern frontend systems, a component-based strategy is often followed, where every component has a specific behavior and responsibility.

paragraphs.name: 41d4
paragraphs.text: This often results in having tens or even hundreds of components, and of course, component communication becomes an interesting topic that needs to be tackled elegantly.

paragraphs.name: 008d
paragraphs.text: Several strategies emerged to help in providing solutions such as the flux pattern, event emissions or callbacks and props.

paragraphs.name: 10dc
paragraphs.text:
Do Your Vue Components Communicate Correctly?
Seven patterns, pick the right onemedium.com

paragraphs.name: f97d
paragraphs.text: 10. Cover Your Code With Automated Tests

paragraphs.name: f3ff
paragraphs.text: This is hands down one of the most challenging tasks in front-end development yet most teams, unfortunately, are not doing enough automated testing on the frontend.

paragraphs.name: 5bab
paragraphs.text: Having different browsers and screen sizes to supports, lots of the heavy lifting being moved to the fronted makes it crucial to have automated tests in place if you want to maintain your product quality.

paragraphs.name: be2f
paragraphs.text: Explore unit tests, snapshot tests, and end to end tests.

paragraphs.name: 44f1
paragraphs.text:
Pragmatic Front-End Testing Strategies (1)
Part 1: Necessity of Pragmatic Front-End Testing Strategiesmedium.com

paragraphs.name: 778b
paragraphs.text: 10. Get Out Of Your Comfort Zone

paragraphs.name: c1f9
paragraphs.text: At some point, with enough practice, you will feel confident enough in your framework of choice. This is the point where you should jump ships and explore another framework.

paragraphs.name: 369a
paragraphs.text: Getting out of your comfort zone will allow you to have an objective view on the differences between frameworks and understand that the whole framework wars are pointless.

paragraphs.name: 33be
paragraphs.text: You will also be able to transfer some concepts over and your ability to jump from one framework to another will skyrocket. So go ahead and learn new frameworks be it React, Angular, Vue or Stencil there are tons of them I├ö├ç├ûm sure you will find one you like.

paragraphs.name: 152c
paragraphs.text: 11. Go Beyond
I believe that most likely if you reached this point you will be acing most of the tasks that get into your way. Nevertheless, the world of frontend has no ends.

paragraphs.name: aa13
paragraphs.text: Go and explore topics such as server-side rendering, Jamstack, accessibility, mobile applications, desktop application, service workers, algorithms, functional programming.
12. Remember To Have Fun

paragraphs.name: af7c
paragraphs.text: Programming can be fun and enjoyable, if you are always writing code you might lose this feeling so I recommend that you start a side project with no financial benefits, no learning purpose, just for fun.

paragraphs.name: 506e
paragraphs.text: Building something you want to use, experiment with technology, do the things you always wanted to do and never had time for.

paragraphs.name: d9bd
paragraphs.text: Thanks for reading, I hope that you use this quarantine as an opportunity to grow and learn more. Be Safe and enjoy your stay at home.

paragraphs.name: 7a70
paragraphs.text: A note from JavaScript In Plain English:

paragraphs.name: b0f2
paragraphs.text: We are always interested in helping to promote quality content. If you have an article that you would like to submit to JavaScript In Plain English, send us an email at submissions@javascriptinplainenglish.com with your Medium username and we will get you added as a writer.
